member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.Abandon
member.summary: Terminates the storyboard, releases all related animation variables, and removes the storyboard from the schedule.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.AddKeyframeAfterTransition
member.summary: Adds a keyframe at the end of the specified transition.
member.param: The transition after which a keyframe is to be added.
The keyframe to be added.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: The transition has not been added to the storyboard.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.AddKeyframeAtOffset
member.summary: Adds a keyframe at the specified offset from an existing keyframe.
member.param: The existing keyframe. To add a keyframe at an offset from the start of the storyboard, use the special keyframe UI_ANIMATION_KEYFRAME_STORYBOARD_START.
The offset from the existing keyframe at which a new keyframe is to be added.
The keyframe to be added.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.AddTransition
member.summary: Adds a transition to the storyboard.
member.param: The animation variable for which the transition is to be added.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: This transition has already been added to a storyboard.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.AddTransitionAtKeyframe
member.summary: Adds a transition that starts at the specified keyframe.
member.param: The animation variable for which a transition is to be added.
The transition to be added.
The keyframe that specifies the beginning of the new transition.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: This transition has already been added to a storyboard or has been added to a storyboard that has finished playing and been released.
The transition might eclipse the beginning of another transition in the storyboard.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.AddTransitionBetweenKeyframes
member.summary: Adds a transition between two keyframes.
member.param: The animation variable for which the transition is to be added.
The transition to be added.
A keyframe that specifies the beginning of the new transition.
A keyframe that specifies the end of the new transition. It must not be possible for endKeyframe to appear earlier in the storyboard than startKeyframe.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: This transition has already been added to a storyboard or has been added to a storyboard that has finished playing and been released.
The transition might eclipse the beginning of another transition in the storyboard.
The start keyframe might occur after the end keyframe.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.Conclude
member.summary: Completes the current iteration of a keyframe loop that is in progress (where the loop is set to UI_ANIMATION_REPEAT_INDEFINITELY), terminates the loop, and continues with the storyboard.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the storyboard within the specified time, compressing the storyboard if necessary.
member.param: The maximum amount of time that the storyboard can use to finish playing.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.GetElapsedTime
member.summary: Gets the time that has elapsed since the storyboard started playing.
member.param: The elapsed time.

returns.para:
If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.GetStatus
member.summary: Gets the status of the storyboard.
member.param: The storyboard status.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.GetTag
member.summary: Gets the tag for a storyboard.
member.param: The object portion of the tag.
The identifier portion of the tag.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: The storyboard's tag was not set.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.HoldVariable
member.summary: Directs the storyboard to hold the specified animation variable at its final value until the storyboard ends.
member.param: The animation variable.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.RepeatBetweenKeyframes
member.summary: Creates a loop between two specified keyframes.
member.param: The keyframe at which the loop is to begin.
The keyframe at which the loop is to end. It must not be possible for endKeyframe to occur earlier in the storyboard than startKeyframe.

The number of times the loop is to be repeated; this parameter must be 0 or a positive number. Use UI_ANIMATION_REPEAT_INDEFINITELY (-1) to repeat the loop indefinitely until the storyboard is trimmed or concluded.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: The start keyframe might occur after the end keyframe.
It might not be possible to determine the end keyframe time when the start keyframe is reached.
Two repeated portions of a storyboard might overlap.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.Schedule
member.summary: Directs the storyboard to schedule itself for play.
member.param: The current time.
The result of the scheduling request. This parameter can be omitted from calls to this method.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.SetLongestAcceptableDelay
member.summary: Sets the longest acceptable delay before the scheduled storyboard begins.
member.param: The longest acceptable delay. This parameter can be a positive value, or UI_ANIMATION_SECONDS_EVENTUALLY (-1) to indicate that any finite delay is acceptable.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.SetStoryboardEventHandler
member.summary: Specifies a handler for storyboard events.

param.name: handler
param.para: The handler to be called whenever storyboard status and update events occur.
The specified object must implement the interface or be NULL. See Remarks.

member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard.SetTag
member.summary: Sets the tag for the storyboard.
member.param:
The object portion of the tag.
This parameter can be NULL.
The identifier portion of the tag.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

listheader.description: The storyboard is currently in the schedule.

member.name: IUIAnimationStoryboard
member.summary: Defines a storyboard, which contains a group of transitions that are synchronized relative to one another.
